abstracts.cdata!:
The Tamil Nadu Water Resources
            Consolidation Project (WRCP) will cover the entire state. It
            aims to introduce a more rational and comprehensive approach
            to water resources planning and management which will
            prevent conflicts over water resource allocation and
            environmental degradation; improve the efficiency of water
            use for irrigation through rehabilitation, modernization,
            and improved maintenance so that increasing industrial and
            domestic demands can be met; and to improve the long-term
            sustainability of irrigation systems through enhanced farmer
            participation in operation and maintenance.  The project
            includes three major components: 1) modernization and
            rehabilitation of existing irrigation sub-projects; 2)
            completion of on-going irrigation works on a number of minor
            irrigation schemes; and 3) institutional strengthening,
            training, and special studies aimed at bringing about a
            radical change in the procedures for planning and managing
            water resource use in Tamil Nadu.
